comment.text:
NYP has been our staple for special occasions for more than 10 years. The bartenders, Steve and Steve are the best and usually have our drinks ready before we can belly up to the bar.  Your life isn't complete without trying the Thick Cut Sizzling Bacon with Brooklyn French  sauce.

Their steaks are amazing, sides incredible (although be warned that the cheesy mash potatoes are extremely hot so roof of mouths beware) and the crab cakes are to die for!!!

The manager Alex always has great wine suggestions and their new patio is incredible. I can't wait for the humidity to drop so I can sit and relax by the fire pit!!!

I have been to this location twice, and to be excited about going back every time says something about any restaurant. Atlanta is a city that loves to eat out, we know that, and with that, tons of restaurants are available. With that said, when it was my wife's Bday i knew that I had to bring her here. First off, valets are always cool and on point, wait staff is extremely helpful and willing to take the extra step to make your experience that much better. So we get there on a Saturday night (made reservations) and got seated right away. Placed an order for Apps and drinks. We had the jumbo lump crab cocktail, and it was so fresh and delicious, which it got finished quickly. Then we placed an order for our entrees; ended up with the 40oz Porterhouse for two, which to me, is the perfect for two. Medium rare, broiled to perfection. Got the Fettuccine Alfredo option as a side, all delicious. To end the evening, our waiter surprised my wife with the baked cookie and ice cream and a candle, that was cool and made her night. Details people, details! This by fair is my favorite steakhouse in Atlanta, period. Check them out!

photos.caption: Birthday Fresh Baked Chocolate Chip Cookie

comment.text:
Food was fantastic we ordered a little too much but everything was great.
We had a new server (glad to see they were finding help) he needed a little help. The manager got involved and went way over the top to make us feel special. Thanks

Birthday dinner at New York Prime was GREAT, Everyone enjoyed their food. The crab cake was the most flavorful item for me . Oyster Rockefeller  was a big hit cause you can barely find them any more in Atlanta. The sides were awesome- the music was a little too loud so people had to talk louder at the table. The bar was packed. Outside seating  was extremely packed. The kitchen was backed up so it took food about an hour  or even longer to come out. Shout out to the bar tender who made the strong drinks. Had a whiskey sour and a manhattan! Order the Lamb Chops for entree . Others or the New York Strip, chicken and Salmon! Oh let me not forget the caesar salad was on point as well. I would most definitely go back and enjoy another night out with friends and family!

I have been coming here due to a dear family friend for many years. Back in town for the holidays & the opportunity to return presented itself.  I would give Andrew our Bartender double the stars if allotted as his service was simply impeccable. 

Andrew's presence was immaculate while his persona beamed when he greeted his regulars by name & engagingly welcomed new patrons to the restaurant's bar. Pouring & blending are only the small part of the bartending equation. Showing personality & exuding the art of customer interaction effortlessly, brings the great bar experience all together.   

The plan for one glass of wine honestly changed due to Andrew's service.  I kindly received his Malbec preferences & after a few of his generous pours, I decided to stay for dinner...other reservations were cancelled. 

With a slight modification, I ordered the Salmon that was prepared blackened & abundantly topped with sautéed Portobello Mushrooms. Preparation, point & price paired nicely. 

I've always prefer how NYP offers their sides - individual or table size. I opted for the individual serving of the Garlic Spinach which was still a big portion. I'm never disappointed with my meals here & decided to share the good vibes by bestowing my ManBaby with his favorite dish - the Garlic Chicken with a 1 pound loaded giant Baked Potato.

Such a blessing to be amongst one of my favored people Randy F., who introduced me to NYP back in the mid 90's. 

Seeing familiar faces, meeting new ones, enduring a close knit atmosphere with soothing live music, delighting in a good meal & fabulously served by Andrew, made my long over due return to New York Prime enjoyable throughout.

Everything here was AMAZING! It was my first time here came for a bday celebration and the food was awesome the service was awesome. Everything was fresh and delicious. We had the salmon, the lamb and the shrimp Alfredo pasta. The mashed potatoes was perfection. So soft and creamy. The lamb was the best lamb I've ever had. Will definitely be coming back.

Best of the Best. You will be pleasantly surprised by the Crab cakes.  All lump crab. Best in Atlanta.  Online ordering and delivery very timely.  Food is Fresh and well prepared to your liking. Large portions. Would highly recommend the Inside Dinning also. Great Service. 
Home-movie night or party this place tops all the rest. Always Delivers Excellence.

My girlfriend and I went to NY Prime Wednesday night to celebrate a late Valentine's day dinner as she is a nurse and I am in the service industry myself and we both had to work V-Day.  Our server Leo was ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!  I had the Seabass and she had the filet.  Our entrees were so delicious that we actually wound up swapping plates mid-dinner!  Our hostess was friendly and genuinely greeted us as we walked in and took us straight to a nice table.  Leo paced our meal to where we could enjoy everything and take our time, asking if we had any questions and checked up on us to make sure we had everything we needed.  Working in fine dining myself, Leo definitely hit all the marks that my own boss would expect me to execute.  Thank you and GOOD JOB NY PRIME!  We will be back and recommend you to friends and family for a great dining experience!

P.S. - Ask for Leo!

There is no other dinner I'd rather have. New York Prime is our go-to birthday and anniversary spot. We've tried other restaurants for special occasions, and I always end up wishing I had just gone to New York Prime. Period.

Let me tell you why: consistency. When I come here, I know I am going to get amazing service and the food is going to be perfect every single time. That speaks volumes, especially with the money you're spending and the fact that it's a special occasion. You want it to be a great experience!

The steaks are out of this world. So delicious and juicy and perfect every time, with just enough char to make it interesting. I realize the charred exterior may sound off-putting to some, but we love it and I encourage you to at least give it a chance.

Also, three words: cheesy mashed potatoes. I cannot emphasize this enough. I literally have dreams about these cheesy potatoes, they are exquisite. 

Finally, since we always come for a birthday or anniversary, they are kind enough to provide us with a complimentary dessert at the end, which is just such a class-act thing to do, in my opinion. 

So yeah. I absolutely love it here. It's classy. It's expensive. It's sooo worth it.

Awesome restaurant, enjoyed the food, service, and atmosphere.  Their steaks are cooked in a Philadelphia style at 1700 degrees, my rebeye steak arrived cooked perfect jast as I'd ordered.  My table had a dedicated server.  I will return

I've eaten a lot of steaks and, for the price, I wouldn't put this one towards the top. I think they were simply lacking in seasoning or flavor on their steak (I've had better at Ruth's Chris -- and my favorite is still Le Moo in Louisville, KY). The side dishes of mushrooms and Brussel sprouts outshined the steaks. The service here was impeccable, however.

Warning: The inside felt unsafe during the pandemic because it was so crowded, but, fortunately, we had reserved outdoor seating, which felt a lot safer.

owner_replies.comment:
Hi Telly, Thank you for taking the time to review us. I'm sorry you didn't feel safe in the restaurant. We understand and appreciate the severity of COVID-19 and wanted to let you know what we are doing so that you may feel better about visiting again. We have been strictly following the Atlanta facemask order as well as the CDC guidelines by keeping tables 6 ft apart from each other, reserving tables for social distancing and  installing clear plexi-glass in between booths to make for a safer dining experience. We are also taking the extra step of sanitizing all touchable surfaces in the restaurant every 30 minutes and as you know, we have a socially distanced patio with plenty of fresh air. Please feel free to reach out me the next time you are thinking of coming in so that I may personally see to it that you have a great time from start to finish. My email is edinino@newyorkprime.rest or you can ask for me at the restaurant 404-846-0644
I look forward to taking care of you. Cheers, Ennio DI Nino, Operating Partner

comment.text:
This place has a nice atmosphere, friendly staff and great food. This was my first visit to the  
restaurant. I do plan to return. Highly recommend

photos.caption: Chopped Steak Of Prime , Aged Beef

comment.text:
My wife and I went for Christmas Day dinner 400 pm.
It was freezing cold with air vents blowing cold air everywhere.
We complained to Daniele our waitress and she said she was hot.
After we ate our appetizers it took more than 30 minutes to get our food, crazy for what you pay. We got an apology by the manager nothing more.
We will never go to this place again, terrible.

Great atmosphere and excellent staff. Wonderful service! One of the signatures of this restaurant is the cooking method on steaks producing a charring  affect. Last night was a packed house we had to wait about 10 minutes for our reserved table. They had a great table available for us. Steaks came out charred for sure even at medium rare. Really took away from the flavor of the steak. Too crispy on the outside. Noticed the couple next to us sent there steaks back with wrong temperatures.

May consider another visit based on atmosphere and super attentive staff. Will definitely request less charring.

Great steaks: fair sides. While the steaks were tasty and cooked well, the sides left a lot to be desired. We asked if the Brussels sprouts were crispy, and our waiter confirmed the were.  However, they were a far cry from crispy!

8 pm reservation tonight. They give a 15 minute grace period. Entire party arrived by 8:05. It's 8:50 and we're still waiting to be seated but had we been late our reservation would've been cancelled. I will not be returning here.

Absolutely horrendous experience.  Started by sitting in the enclosed patio which did not prevent  the rain from flooding in, soaking our party of 4, shoes and wife's coat.  Next up the wind almost toppled a heater next to us but nothing could compare to the treatment by the Geno Dew, the maitre'd for what occurred next. An adjacent table with whom ours had zero conversation with, upon leaving as we were getting our dinner, approached our table in total lunatic breakout.  Threatening us, cussing, berating, completely insane.  Once escorted out leaving us in complete shock, all that Dew could offer was to "enjoy your meal"! He was more concerned with our calling the police, speaking with others for contact info than the ridiculous harmful experience we'd just encountered.  Was an absolute joke, we were devastated and Dew did NOTHING to recognize and console our group.  His condescending and arrogant attitude was a disgrace to any/all "5 star" restaurants. Do yourself a favor and stay with Rathbun's, Hals or Bones...even Waffle House! They treat all customers with class and go above and beyond!

My late night dinner was delicious! I sat at the bar and Steve waited on me ! He is the best - I had the 8oz filet with cream spinach and let's just say the steak melted in my mouth. I started with the oyster Rockefeller which was also scrumptious- oh and the wedge salad yummy ! The presentation of the food and the ambiance is definitely a winner here !

Fantastic atmosphere, steaks were cooked perfectly, and drinks were crafted beautifully. Service seemed personal yet professional making the evening memorable. The chocolate cake - get it. Bring it home and keep eating it cause it is quite large.

Can be pricey (like any steakhouse) if you make it that way, thus a great spot for a night out to celebrate. The bar could be more of a place for regular dining with another, as I could see ordering sides (which are large) or appetizers to share with some delicious drinks.

This was my first experience at this restaurant. We had a reservation for 9 but wasn't seated to close to 10pm. Once seated, everything went well. Our server was extremely knowledgeable on the menu as well as what he recommended. The crab cakes were AMAZING. I ordered the chicken with sautéed spinach as my entree and it was delicious. Outside of the wait, i have no complaints. Definitely recommend
Great service! Definitely worth the money!! Our waitress was very nice & took care of all our needs.

New York Prime was amazing. I went last night with friends, and had a ball. We started off with a garlic shrimp appetizer. The shrimps were HUGE! Packed with a powerful flavor. For dinner, I ordered with garlic chicken, with spinach, and broccoli. Everything was fresh and flavorful.

Nicholas was an AMAZINGGGG waiter. He was funny, helpful, and just all-around an amazing guy. 

When i come back to Atlanta, i will be paying this restaurant a visit again.

After waiting for an hour , probably not their fault with how people behaving these days. Food was sub par compared to Halz , Chops or Marcels for around the same price.  I think the baked shrimp is what made me sick.  Are waiter was the only saving grace, that Dude was amazing.  The bar tenders looked like they couldn't keep up on a normal day never the less a Saturday night. The valet and bus boys were killing it tho too.  The inside isn't very impressive for a "high" end steak house.  More like a hotel bar. Won't be returning.

This place is just what the name says our server Sterling was on point with all the needs the ribeye was amazing the Brussels sprouts we delicious this place is more than the name it's about the service for me

This was my first time here and I will be back! Forgot to take pics but I ordered the baked shrimp for an appetizer which was ok. I would probably try another appetizer next time but still pretty good just not as good as I expected. 

For the main entree, lamb chops paired with the cheesy potatoes were very delicious! Thee service and ambience were good too and it's a plus that there is free valet.

Awesome background Valentine's Day dinner from prime. 5 stars across the board.  Nothing bad from me on this restaurant. Customer service was superb from valet to the host to our table an waiter. The bottle still water was chill, my glass of prosecco was chill. The only thing that was a little turn down was the Caesar salad it was a little salty other than that thumbs up. Next we order our entrees which was 22oz rib steak medium well with large bake potato loaded and new York strip with a large bake potato and caramelized onions on the side. That 22oz was so freaking good I couldn't finish it of course, which made a nice doggy bag. Over all, it was a awesome experience to have with your love one on a romantic night. I would definitely be back again.

This place may be the worst steakhouse I've ever been to. I don't usually write bad reviews but this experience was something else. We were a party of 10 with a reservation at 8pm. My friend who was hosting the dinner for some reason called and they informed us that they needed to switch the reservation to 9pm. So, had she not called, we would've arrived at the restaurant with no table. However, although we did arrive at 9, we were able to sit down until 10. On top of that, the only reason we were able to sit down was because I had come to  see if the table was ready, and it had been sitting ready and empty for at least 10 minutes. The hostess did not even walk us to the table. Furthermore, the food was just bad; no further explanation needed. They even filled up my friend's sprite with water. 0/10 do not recommend.

I had a great time at this restaurant. The food was hot, fresh and delicious. I indulged in multiply appetizers, and red fish almandine. The service was quick. Everyone was polite and happy. Upon leaving the restaurant my party had an issue with a wallet. I want to thank Gino who listened to my concerns, reviewed footage and called promptly to address the issue. Great place to dine.
Food was amazing as well as the service !! First time trying lamb chops and it was delicious!! Crab cakes, salmon and drinks was delicious!! Well worth the money !!

Like WOW! Food amazing. Staff amazing. Valet amazing. It's 1 or 2 things. This place is amazing or I don't get out enough. I was completely wowed. Of course steaks were ordered ACROSS the board, surely I tried everyone's plate. Totally worth the car note I paid there that night and will totally risk my lively hood again in the near future for the place. Bravo all. Bravo!

My wife and I have been to many of the upper tier steak houses around Buckhead over the years and have noticed a drop-off in service. New York Prime restored our faith in quality food with exceptional service.

Our waiter, Kyle, was fantastic. He was attentive without being intrusive. Our drinks were never below a quarter without being offered a fresh one. The meal was properly coordinated with each course coming perfectly timed as we completed the last.

My wife had the filet and I had a strip; both steaks done to our liking. The bisque was very good and had plenty of meat in it. We had to take the cheesecake to go but it exceeded expectations as well.

We will be back
Went  here with another couple who this is the go to spot. The steaks are amazing and the large lobster was so tender for being a big crustacean. Service was so good and the desserts are super tasty.
Our family love New York Prime. We love the filet and crab cakes. The bar tenders are awesome!!!

photos.caption: Our family loves New York Prime!

comment.text: Absolutely incredible experience! I wish I had asked the waiter for his name (he of course said his name when we sat down but I quickly forgot) because his great service and knowledge definitely added to value of our overall experience. The food was fantastic, I am from NY and have dined at many steakhouses, New York Prime is by far the best food I've had at a steakhouse. Appetizers we had the Oysters Rockefeller, Jumbo Baked Shrimp, and crab cakes. All three were amazing! Entree we had the New York Strip 16oz and the Bone-In rib 22oz with a side of cheesy mash. Steaks were perfectly cooked and charred just the right amount. I will absolutely be back here on my next visit to Atlanta!

photos.caption: New York Strip - 16 Oz , Cheese Mashed Potatoes, béarnaise sauce
Oysters Rockefeller Crab Cake Baked Shrimp

comment.text: Went here for my birthday with my family and it was one of the best food experiences of my life. The ambiance of the restaurant was beautiful, and amusingly there were steam punk cosplayers from a local convention at the bar. We started off with the Oysters Rockefeller, which were just amazing. Personally, I liked it better than the baked shrimp but both were extremely fresh that I could still taste the saltwater.  I ordered the Petite Steak and it was one of the best steaks of my life; I ordered it medium-well and it was amazingly tender and well-seasoned. My mother ordered the crab cakes, she said it was good but she said it was a bit salty (take that with a grain of salt though :)). My father ordered the Sea Bass and said it was a tad bit dry but it was very good. For dessert we ordered the Butter Cake, which was huge but very delicious. I also got a complimentary desert for my birthday, which was very nice. The service was A+ and although I forgot the name of our server, he was very nice and we chatted about our college experiences. Overall, highly recommend and I don't regret spending my birthday dinner there!

photos.caption: Butter Cake, Fresh Baked Chocolate Chip Cookie

comment.text: Great atmosphere. They cook their steaks Pittsburgh style which my favorite. Had a phenomenal waiter, Leo. Will definitely be back soon.

user.name: Brolin E.
user.address: Legacy At The River Line, Mableton, GA

comment.text:
My wife and I came here for Valentine's Day. It started off with good service, until our entree came. After we hade portioned the sides, I noticed there was a 'made in China' tag that had been deep fried into our brussel sprouts. The waiter never came over to check after the food was served, so I had to flag him down. He apologized and took them back to the kitchen. Meanwhile, we cut into the steak. We ordered medium and it came out raw. I knew it was raw, despite the darkness in the restaurant. I took my phone out and used the flash light. It was definitely raw. I had to flag him down again. They took the cut up $85 steak back and threw it back in the oven, brought it out, and didn't even come back to check if the temp was good. A manager never came out and apologized. I've never had an experience like this at a restaurant of this supposed caliber. It doesn't matter what grade of meat you have if you can't cook it. As we were leaving, I asked to speak with the manager. He had just walked up. He said he was sorry and that no one had alerted him. He gave me his card and said to call if we came back. I honestly, don't care to go back. We would've been better off going to Little Alley. At least the server and manager are present and ask if everything was good there.  I expected better customer service and food for the price point.

Additionally, the restaurant did not follow proper social distancing guidelines. The guy next to us (within 4 feet of our table) proceeded to pull his chair around to where he was within 2 feet of our table.

photos.caption: Raw $85 Steak that was supposed to be cooked to medium temperature.

comment.text: first time there and i must say the food was good.. customer service was very slow.. drinks was good.. beautiful decor.. they offer valet parking.. what i don't like is the fact u have to wait until your entire party has arrived... definitely will be return when it's less busy so i can have better customer service

This place is great! Had dinner here for our Anniversary Saturday on August 8, 2020 and the food was fantastic! We had Oyster Rockefeller and Shrimp Cocktail for appetizers. Main course I had SeaBass and my husband had Filet. For sides we had mash potatoes, cream corn, and garlic spinach. They gave us a free dessert for our anniversary. Large warm chocolate chip cookieI with vanilla ice cream. Yummy 
I also had a French Martini and it was delicious!
Everyone was friendly and our waiter was awesome! Definitely going back again, very nice restaurant.

It was ok. My bone in rib eye was ok in flavor and cooked to the perfect temp. My broccolini taste great but super hard.  My thick sizzling bacon was great. My oysters on a half shell were amazing. My lemon drop martini was not good at all i had to send it back. I got a cosmo instead it was better than the lemon drop but i wouldn't order it again.  Overall nice experience, nice ambiance but I will not return not because it's nasty only because I've had better.

Dining alone can be weird, however when I explained to John that I love a great steak he took care of everything for me. I had a bone in cut that was out of this world. 

The service was superb and upon finding out I was dining alone and complimenting the chef, he came out to my table to thank me for the accolades and asked if there was anything else he could do for me.

So glad I took a chance on this based upon reviews, must visit again when I am in Atlanta.

Sea Bass was as delish as they come!! Rockefellers were on point. Shrimp cocktail was delish...Big #10 shrimp, and they were cold and fresh. All the food came out lightning fast! The only bummer is the smoking inside the restaurant!! Other wise...5 stars here!! Cant wait till 1.1.2020...NO MAS SMOKING

Oh man, I had a delicious meal tonight, I enjoyed the fresh oysters and crunchy cold shrimp for appetizer, and ordered Salmon with mushrooms main dish. I also tried little piece of the roasted chicken it was okay but I'm happy with what I ordered. 
Aren't you sure what to order? I would recommend you The Salmon with Mushrooms so tasty.

photos.caption: Fresh Oysters and Crunchy Cold Shrimp.

comment.text: A great steakhouse with a beautiful romantic ambience. Order all the sides they're delicious!

I had to send my lamb chops back - overcooked. By the time I got it I was full from sides and just took it home. Not a penny comped. David our server was great. I was uneasy the whole night. No social distancing at all.  Most restaurants I go to have tables spread apart somewhat. NY Prime I guess takes profit over safety. People packed in like sardines. I have been a customer of the restaurant for 20 years. I expected more and after spending as much for a special birthday dinner. Won't be back. Very dissatisfied

Best steak I have eaten. For starters, seafood plate had lobster, crabs, shrimp and oysters. Good size for a group and very tasty. The lobster and shrimp bisque had hood amount of protein but salty. Filet cooked Pittsburgh style (little salt with butter cooked at 1700 degrees) was the best steak I ever had. Not too pretty on the outside at that heat but it was cooked perfectly and very juicy. All the side we're good, my favorite was the mushrooms. Service was great, attentive and prompt. Very classy with live music. Only downside was the people smoking cigars at the bar. This place became one of my favorites.

photos.caption: Center Cut Filet - 12 Oz . Barrel Cut

comment.text: I HIGHLY don't recommend this restaurant! They are very unprofessional. We book a reservation online for a party of 8 in advance 5 mins before our arrival time to the restaurant manager name Alex called us and said that he had to cancel our reservation because the restaurant is too full come back two hours I tried to explain to him that is extremely late and that it's super inconvenience because we have kids with us that is super hungry and he didn't care at all. I will not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

owner_replies.comment: Hi Nahema, I'm sorry that you weren't able to join us. We're not very nimble in terms of reservation size, as your reservation was booked for a party of 2 with a note that you were a party of 9. We never want to turn guests away but if we do not have the availability for the a large group, we cannot accommodate. Alex did his best to seat you at a later time. In the future, since reservations for 8+ are not able to be made online, please call us for availability. Thank you for understanding, we wish you a happy holidays.

comment.text:
Upon arriving I wasn't sure we were in the right place because there were a lot of men standing around smoking cigars and drinking at the bar and I wasn't sure where to check in. 

Once we found the guy with the help of the valet gentleman he took us to our table. We made reservations online. This was our first time eating here we were celebrating our 9 year anniversary. 

I ordered a salad to start and we both ordered steaks with creamy spinach and southwestern corn. The steaks were absolutely amazing!!! They didn't require any sauce whatsoever. Since it was our anniversary they gave us a dessert on the house it was a warm chocolate chip cookie with ice cream. That was the best cookie I've ever eaten and I don't like chocolate. 

The only thing that I did not like about the restaurant was the smoking of the cigars. I don't like to be around smoke, I don't smoke. It was annoying to have to eat with the smell of smoke. It was worse that when I got home my clothes and hair smelled like it. I really really disliked that.

I went here for a friends birthday. I ordered the petite steak, medium well with a side of mushrooms. We waited almost 2 hours for our food!!! When the food arrived I received a well done NY prime steak.... I told the waiter that wasn't my steak but he insisted that was what I ordered. Smh not pleased at all!

owner_replies.comment: Hi Jennifer, We are very sorry that we did not meet your expectations and did not live up to our own high standards. There should have been no reason for the delay in receiving your meal. As for your incorrect steak temperature, we broiled all our steaks pittsburgh-style on a 1700 degree broiler that creates a charred outside, and as noted on our menu, we don't recommend cooking temperatures from medium well and above. That was likely the issue. Despite this recent experience, we know we can still wow you and hope you'll give us another chance.

comment.text: Beautiful restaurant and the food is amazing, customer service was excellent Emmanuel was great
